response.overview: Bulgaria is under Ottoman rule. Vasil Levski, the Bulgarian national hero, arrives in a small town to organize the revolutionary committee. However, Turkish authorities discover the meeting, forcing the conspirators to scatter. A local schoolteacher, Hristina, who is in love with Levski, becomes a target of Turkish spies alongside the priest Nikola, a secret supporter of the revolution. Both are arrested and brutally tortured, as is Levski’s mother, who is thrown into a well. Disguised, Levski closely follows the posse hunting him and manages to overcome numerous dangers to rescue Hristina. Meanwhile, the blinded priest continues to pray for his enslaved people. Suddenly, a miracle occurs — church bells ring on their own, inspiring hope and signaling that liberation is near.
response.title: Buntat na robite
